properties.media:imagetext:
BAYSIDE COMPANY
400
California St.
San Francisco
December 13,1926
Mr. Joseph J.Phillips
Right of Way Agent
City & County of San Francisco
San Francisco, California
Subject Airport.
Dear Sir:
In
view of
the likelihood that Site No.1 will not be
accepted by the City in accordance with our letter to you
dated September 20,1926:
The Bayside Company hereby gives
notice that a limitation of time is placed
upon the
offer made
in said letter, of fifteen days from and including December
16,1926.
Should the said limitation expire and
the offer of
September 29th
automatically become void, the Bayside Company
hereby offers the following proposal:
That Bayside Company will lease to the City all of
Site No.1 Lying between the Bay Shore Highway and the
Power Line
Right of Way for a term not to exceed three years at a rental
my be Hundred 00118 a Paroper us tas a am.
and assegsments that
This offer is made so that the City may be in immediate
possession of a Landing Field to meet the urgent
Commercial Aviation, and conditional upon the purchase and development
by the City of Site No.4 so-called, apparently the closest site to
San Francisco that can be made into a suitable Air Port.
Site No.4 in its position relative to Site No.1 will allow
temporary
use of Site No.l
as an immediste relief and will build up
in the immediate vicinity of the ultimate development.
The Bayside Company is disposed to cooperate in a movement
that will result in the acquisition by the City of the best possible
Air Port and also give immediste relief to a pressing situation.
Very truly
yours,
BAYSIDE COMPANY
By -
Secretary
Edina
